What an amazing experience! Service, food, music - loved every minute of it! Would definitely come back!
A place that I haven't been to in 10 years and still as great as it was back then. Absolutely fabulous

My experience at Nobu Downtown was absolutely amazing. The service was impeccable‚Äîattentive, professional, and perfectly timed. I tried the tasting menu, and it was truly worth it. Every dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. From start to finish, everything was delicious. Highly recommend for a special night out in New York!

Came here to celebrate an anniversary dinner in the middle of the week. Surprisingly it was not as busy as I was expecting at 6:30pm. Food quality and taste was ok, but presentation was amazing. Seating was ample in the lower level. Service was good but I could tell they were short staffed based on the wait times.

In terms of menu items, I would recommend the crispy rice and the specialty roles.
Very cool space among the columns. Food is very good. Literally everything we ordered was outstanding, even things that would be basic somewhere else were elevated here.

Upon arrival, we were met at the front by a gentleman who was immediately dismissive and rude. Without any effort to accommodate or welcome us, he told us we could "crowd around the bar." The tone and delivery were unnecessarily dismissive, a stark contrast to the hospitality I‚Äôve come to expect at Nobu.

Things unfortunately didn‚Äôt improve. He later walked past our table and gave us a pointed, unfriendly look, which felt like a deliberate mean mug. When one of our guests politely asked where the restroom was, he responded with clear irritation, even rolling his eyes. As we were leaving, he gave me a long, passive aggressive stare that felt both unprofessional and uncalled for.

I‚Äôve never encountered this kind of behavior in all my years of frequenting Nobu, and it truly makes me reconsider returning. I'm not sure where this individual's energy came from this evening, but his demeanor and approach are entirely misaligned with the Nobu standard of experience.
